summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/02/10 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Simon Wincer'], 'Producers': ["Stanley O'toole", 'Alexandra Rose'], 'Starring': ['Tom Selleck', 'Laura San Giacomo', 'Alan Rickman']} Review Text: I have been a fan of this film from the first time I saw it. It is a good twist on the classic Western theme. Selleck's character has some great John Wayne-style cowboy cool to him. It likely didn't get as much critical acclaim as it deserves because it was merely PG-13 and lacked buckets of blood, cursing, or gratuitous sex scenes.

It's just a good story, with plenty of action, some comedy romance. Highly recommended. Review Title: Terrific, underrated film Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Star Trek: The Original Series Review Date: 2014/02/18 Categories: Adventure, Science Fiction, Action Product Description: ['201 years after man first traveled faster than the speed of light, Captain James T. Kirk and his crew set forth in the constitution class USS Enterprise.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Marc Daniels', 'Joseph Pevney', 'Ralph Senensky', 'Vincent McEveety', 'Jud Taylor', 'Herb Wallerstein', 'Robert Butler', 'Marvin J. Chomsky', 'John Meredyth Lucas', 'Gerd Oswald'], 'Producers': ['Gene Roddenberry', 'Douglas S. Cramer'], 'Starring': ['William Shatner', 'Leonard Nimoy', 'DeForest Kelley']} Review Text: I grew up watching these, reading the books -- I was a "Trekkie" before it was cool. I always worry when someone is going to "improve" or "enhance" something I've loved for years. However, the digital enhancement on these episodes only makes them that much more enjoyable. The ship looks even more amazing now. Review Title: Nothing compares to the original Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Avengers: The Complete Emma Peel Megaset Review Date: 2014/03/20 Store: Diana Rigg (Actor), Roy Ward Baker (Director) Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, All Lionsgate Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', 'The original British TV cult classic is back with an all-new look! Starring Diana Rigg as Emma Peel and Patrick Macnee as her engaging partner John Steed. Fans will rejoice in watching the infamous crime-fighting duo, the Avengers, who have influenced generations of stars in 51 episodes, on16 DVD discs. Enjoy every Emma episode ever in this ultimate collectors edition!', 'Amazon.com', 'Review', 'See more'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.42 Pounds', 'Item model number': 'LGT45393DVD', 'Director': 'Roy Ward Baker', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color, Full Screen, Dolby, Box set', 'Run time': '47 hours', 'Release date': 'October 8, 2013', 'Actors': 'Diana Rigg', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '16'} Review Text: I've been a fan of the Avengers -- and Emma Peel -- since I was 6 years old. I've been wanting this set for years, and it finally dropped to a price I could afford. The case for the disks is cheaply made and not the most convenient in the world -- but if that keeps the price down, I'm fine with a little extra work to get to the next disk in the series.

Now when I want to relax, I can just turn on my DVD player and enjoy some good, odd, British secret agent stories -- and of course the captivating Dame Diana Rigg. "Mrs. Peel, we're needed!" Review Title: Love it! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Knight and Day Review Date: 2016/10/14 Store: Tom Cruise (Actor), Cameron Diaz (Actor), James Mangold (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray Product Description: ['In the action-comedy KNIGHT AND DAY, Tom Cruise is a covert agent and Cameron Diaz is a woman caught between him and those he claims set him up. As their globetrotting adventure erupts into a maze of double-crosses, close escapes, false identities, and head-spinning romantic snafus, they come to realize that all they can count on is each other.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action/Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': "Christian Finnegan, Patrick O'Neill, Rich Manley, Nilaja Sun, Jack A. O'Connell, Paul Dano, Jordi Molla, Taylor Treadwell, Falk Hentschel, James Mangold, Dale Dye, Trevor Loomis, Celia Weston, Viola Davis, Tommy Nohilly, Lennie Loftin, Tom Cruise, Maggie Grace, Peter Sarsgaard, Gal Gadot, Cameron Diaz, Marc BlucasChristian Finnegan, Patrick O'Neill, Rich Manley, Nilaja Sun, Jack A. O'Connell, Paul Dano, Jordi Molla, Taylor Treadwell, Falk Hentschel, James Mangold, Dale Dye, Trevor Loomis, Celia Weston, Viola Davis, Tommy Nohilly, Lennie Loftin, Tom Cruise, Maggie Grace, Peter Sarsg… See more", 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 49 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'B00PGTN9R6', 'Director': 'James Mangold', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 49 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 6, 2015', 'Actors': 'Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Peter Sarsgaard, Viola Davis, Jordi Molla', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX', 'Writers': "Patrick O'Neill", 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '3'} Review Text: Knight and Day is a movie I've owned before on standard DVD. A friend "borrowed" it, and I haven't seen that disk since. I decided I like it enough to go ahead an buy it again on BluRay.

The movie is a great, fun, action/comedy -- the kind you know won't win any academy awards but you don't care. Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz have good chemistry and comedic timing -- but what really makes the movie is the end. So as not to spoil anything, it suffices to say that some things come full circle. Great popcorn movie. Review Title: I decided I like it enough to go ahead an buy it again ... Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: DCU: Batman: Gotham By Gaslight (Blu-Ray) Review Date: 2019/01/07 Store: Bruce Greenwood (Actor), Jennifer Carpenter (Actor), Sam Liu (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['DCU: Batman: Gotham By Gaslight (Blu-Ray)', 'Gotham City, at the turn of the century, is experiencing a golden era of discovery and industry as showcased by affluent businessman Bruce Wayne’s World Fair. Down in the darkest alleys, there is a killer on the loose. Preying on the city’s women, this killer is as precise as he is cruel. As Police Commissioner James Gordon tries to calm the fears of Gotham’s citizens over the butcher named Jack the Ripper, the masked vigilante Batman does some detective work of his own, with the help of the sultry and surefooted Selina Kyle. Witness a world in flames as the killer’s controlled savagery meets the calculated stealth of the Dark Knight!', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Animation/General, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'John DiMaggio, Anthony Head, Yuri Lowenthal, Grey DeLisle Griffin, Sam Liu, Sam Register, Jim Krieg, William Salyers, Bruce Timm, Jennifer Carpenter, Scott Patterson, Benjamin Melniker, Michael E. Uslan, Bruce GreenwoodJohn DiMaggio, Anthony Head, Yuri Lowenthal, Grey DeLisle Griffin, Sam Liu, Sam Register, Jim Krieg, William Salyers, Bruce Timm, Jennifer Carpenter, Scott Patterson, Benjamin Melniker, Michael E. Uslan, Bruce Greenwood See more', 'Initial release date': '2018-02-06', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 12 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'February 5, 2021', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Sam Liu', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 12 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 6, 2018', 'Actors': 'Bruce Greenwood, Jennifer Carpenter, Scott Patterson, Anthony Head, Yuri Lowenthal', 'Producers': 'Bruce Timm, Sam Register, Benjamin Melniker, Michael E. Uslan', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Jim Krieg', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I loved the concept of Batman going after the Ripper with a backdrop of the gaslight era. I was anticipating seeing Batman using a lot of cool "steampunkish" gadgets and a dark, gritty atmosphere. I guess they were trying to keep it from freaking out younger viewers, but the story and animation style just never grabbed my attention and held it. As fun a cartoon as it was, it seemed to just fall short of its potential. Review Title: Good, but not great Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/09/06 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', '日本語', 'Português', 'Magyar', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Thor Freudenthal', 'Anna Foerster', 'Andy Goddard', 'Jon Amiel'], 'Producers': ['Renė Echevarria', 'David Minkowski', 'Marc Guggenheim', 'Matthew Stillman', 'Jon Amiel', 'Ian Deitchman', 'Kristin Robinson', 'Travis Beacham', 'Gideon Amir', 'Alex Shevchenko', 'Orlando Bloom'], 'Starring': ['Orlando Bloom', 'Caroline Ford', 'Cara Delevingne'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: FOR PARENTS: THIS IS NOT A CHILDREN-FRIENDLY SERIES. UNVEILED SEX , GORE, AND PROFANITY. The concept is pretty easy to understand: It's the old "downtrodden immigrants being misunderstood and ill-treated" plot that has been told hundreds of times. BUT it is so well written, acted, and directed that I had to force myself to not binge-watch the whole season in one day! As I mentioned first, there are scenes of blatant sex and shots of gooey, dismembered corpses - though none of it truly gratuitous. It was all somewhat necessary to advance the plot. I just hope Amazon doesn't pull another "The Expanse only the first one's free" bait and switch on me again..... Review Title: Best original series to come along in some time! Not for kids! Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz have good chemistry and comedic timing -- but what really makes the movie is the end. So as not to spoil anything, it suffices to say that some things come full circle. Great popcorn movie. Review Title: I decided I like it enough to go ahead an buy it again ... Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: DCU: Batman: Gotham By Gaslight (Blu-Ray) Review Date: 2019/01/07 Store: Bruce Greenwood (Actor), Jennifer Carpenter (Actor), Sam Liu (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['DCU: Batman: Gotham By Gaslight (Blu-Ray)', 'Gotham City, at the turn of the century, is experiencing a golden era of discovery and industry as showcased by affluent businessman Bruce Wayne’s World Fair. Down in the darkest alleys, there is a killer on the loose. Preying on the city’s women, this killer is as precise as he is cruel. As Police Commissioner James Gordon tries to calm the fears of Gotham’s citizens over the butcher named Jack the Ripper, the masked vigilante Batman does some detective work of his own, with the help of the sultry and surefooted Selina Kyle. Witness a world in flames as the killer’s controlled savagery meets the calculated stealth of the Dark Knight!', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Animation/General, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'John DiMaggio, Anthony Head, Yuri Lowenthal, Grey DeLisle Griffin, Sam Liu, Sam Register, Jim Krieg, William Salyers, Bruce Timm, Jennifer Carpenter, Scott Patterson, Benjamin Melniker, Michael E. Uslan, Bruce GreenwoodJohn DiMaggio, Anthony Head, Yuri Lowenthal, Grey DeLisle Griffin, Sam Liu, Sam Register, Jim Krieg, William Salyers, Bruce Timm, Jennifer Carpenter, Scott Patterson, Benjamin Melniker, Michael E. Uslan, Bruce Greenwood See more', 'Initial release date': '2018-02-06', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 12 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'February 5, 2021', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Sam Liu', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 12 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 6, 2018', 'Actors': 'Bruce Greenwood, Jennifer Carpenter, Scott Patterson, Anthony Head, Yuri Lowenthal', 'Producers': 'Bruce Timm, Sam Register, Benjamin Melniker, Michael E. Uslan', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Jim Krieg', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: I loved the concept of Batman going after the Ripper with a backdrop of the gaslight era. I was anticipating seeing Batman using a lot of cool "steampunkish" gadgets and a dark, gritty atmosphere. I guess they were trying to keep it from freaking out younger viewers, but the story and animation style just never grabbed my attention and held it. As fun a cartoon as it was, it seemed to just fall short of its potential. Review Title: Good, but not great Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/09/06 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', '日本語', 'Português', 'Magyar', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Thor Freudenthal', 'Anna Foerster', 'Andy Goddard', 'Jon Amiel'], 'Producers': ['Renė Echevarria', 'David Minkowski', 'Marc Guggenheim', 'Matthew Stillman', 'Jon Amiel', 'Ian Deitchman', 'Kristin Robinson', 'Travis Beacham', 'Gideon Amir', 'Alex Shevchenko', 'Orlando Bloom'], 'Starring': ['Orlando Bloom', 'Caroline Ford', 'Cara Delevingne'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: FOR PARENTS: THIS IS NOT A CHILDREN-FRIENDLY SERIES. UNVEILED SEX , GORE, AND PROFANITY. The concept is pretty easy to understand: It's the old "downtrodden immigrants being misunderstood and ill-treated" plot that has been told hundreds of times. BUT it is so well written, acted, and directed that I had to force myself to not binge-watch the whole season in one day! As I mentioned first, there are scenes of blatant sex and shots of gooey, dismembered corpses - though none of it truly gratuitous. It was all somewhat necessary to advance the plot. I just hope Amazon doesn't pull another "The Expanse only the first one's free" bait and switch on me again..... Review Title: Best original series to come along in some time! Not for kids! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a clear preference for high-quality films and series across various genres, particularly those that blend action, adventure, and a hint of romance or comedy. Consistently high ratings (around 4.5 to 5.0) for diverse titles indicate strong satisfaction with storylines that offer depth, character development, and nostalgic elements, as seen in their strong connection to both classic and contemporary content.

Their reviews highlight a fondness for well-crafted narratives that may include mature content, suggesting comfort with films that explore complex themes rather than overly sanitized depictions. Across the purchase history, there is a recurring appreciation for productions featuring established actors and directors, reflecting a bias towards trusted names in entertainment.

This consumer exhibits a willingness to invest in media that meets quality standards but is also sensitive to pricing, particularly when purchasing items they’ve desired for some time. They show tolerance for minor deficiencies in product quality (like packaging) as long as the price remains reasonable. Overall, their preferences lean towards intelligent, engaging storytelling presented through both nostalgic and new formats, prioritizing quality over sheer volume.

target_interaction.title: Great, fun, inspiring movie - loosely based on history
target_interaction.text: Since you can read all over the web about how this story radically changes the actual historical narrative it is based on, I won't go into that here.  Taken as it is, this movie is a wonderful and inspiring movie about people defying the odds and the status-quo to prove that the present "common knowledge" was dead wrong.  The actors' chemistry, the script, the directing, the sets - all did a fine job of capturing my attention and pulling me, sweaty palms and all, into the adventure. Great fun that I hope will inspire people to realize "You don't change the world simply by looking at it. You change it through the way you choose to live in it".
description: In 1862, daredevil balloon pilot Amelia Wren (Felicity Jones) teams up with pioneering meteorologist James Glaisher (Eddie Redmayne) to advance human knowledge of the weather and fly higher than anyone in history.
